title: Allow rendering whitespace in the search/replace fields
body:
Currently whitespace is simply invisible in the search/replace boxes, even if the `editor.renderWhitespace` is turned on. This routinely results in issues e.g. replacing text with whitespace rather than an empty string, or inability to locate a pattern because it includes whitespace at the end, or tabs rather than spaces, etc.

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
It would be nice to be able to make whitespace visible in find an replace fields, in a way similar to what's shown in the main editor when `editor.renderWhitespace` is on. That would avoid the problems described above.

title: SCSS/SASS Auto Intellisense doesn't work after last entry

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Version: 1.37.0 (system setup)
Commit: 036a6b1d3ac84e5ca96a17a44e63a87971f8fcc8
Date: 2019-08-08T02:33:50.993Z
Electron: 4.2.7
Chrome: 69.0.3497.128
Node.js: 10.11.0
V8: 6.9.427.31-electron.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create .scss file enter expected autocomplete feature (e.g. `&:hover`) and notice that autocomplete works properly.
![autocomplete-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4359573/62889310-1a01de80-bd0f-11e9-93ad-5289bfe4d28e.png)

2. After last block, enter new block with `&` and intellisense is not activated
![autocomplete-after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4359573/62889318-1cfccf00-bd0f-11e9-99fe-7ba953793dcf.png)

3. Before first `&` block, enter new `&:` and intellisense is activated properly
![autocomplete-before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4359573/62889323-20905600-bd0f-11e9-8ece-23d02b07fa44.png)

Same issue in nested blocks. Any attempt to do an `&` block with a pseudo-class after the first one appears to fail. The dev console shows no problems.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: [scss] support passing arguments to content blocks in mixins

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Issue Type: Bug As of [Dart Sass 1.15.0](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/releases/tag/1.15.0), sass supports [passing arguments to content blocks in mixins](https://sass-lang.com/documentation/at-rules/mixin#passing-arguments-to-content-blocks). For example, ``` @mixin rtl($ltr-dir) { .dir_ltr & { @content($ltr-dir); } } @include rtl("left") using ($dir) { margin-#{$dir}: 10px; } ``` Is valid, but vscode scss lint reports errors, notably "scss(css-semicolonexpected)" after the @content and the using keyword VS Code version: Code 1.37.0 (036a6b1d3ac84e5ca96a17a44e63a87971f8fcc8, 2019-08-08T02:33:50.993Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17763

title: Tree view doesn't programatically collapse Tree items

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I'm developing custom VSCode extension and i want to have an option to quickly collapse some expanded tree view items. 
For this purposes I've tried to trigger `onDidChangeTreeData` event and recreate TreeItem with desired collapsible state, but it din't have effect.

There is a pretty similar issue https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/44746 , but solution mentioned in there is only suitable for expanding tree items (I tried to call `reveal` with `expand: false` option, and it didn't work also).

Also `Collapse all` button is not suitable for my needs. 

I'm on Version 1.37.0

title: Allow Go to symbol in the highlighted Go to file after (#) is detected
body:
This is based on one of the features of GoTo Anything in Sublime Text. Here is a sample video demonstrating how it works:
https://youtu.be/48f3N0hCaBU?t=109

From the available VSCode features Go to Symbol in Workspace feels so close to it and still doesn't cover some very useful scenarios. For example:

- When there are many classes that have the same symbol/function name, pre-filtering the file helps to jump to the exact definition instead of navigating within the list

- When the file name is known, but the exact symbol/function name is unclear. Fuzzy searching it should be fast and easy

- It's also useful for quick preview of the available symbols/functions in a given file

These are just a few that come to mind quickly and I am sure that there are other use cases.

title: "files.defaultLanguage" should use current language
body:
VSCode Version: 1.37.0

- OS Version: Sierra 10.13.6
- Wanted behavior:

**Scenario**: 
**Given** I set `"files.defaultLanguage": "current"` (doesn't exist)
**Given** I let's say work in a `javascript` file. 
**When** I create new file via `Ctrl+N`
**Then** I Expect to have a new file new file as `javascript`, not plain text. 

**Scenario**: 
**Given** I set `"files.defaultLanguage": "current"` (doesn't exist)
**Given** I let's say work in a `plain-text` file. 
**When** I create new file via `Ctrl+N`
**Then** I expect to have a new file new file as `plain-text`

Reproduces without extensions: **Yes**

Wondering if I was the only one wanting something like that ?

title: Follow Link Scss doesn't work with ~Tilde to search in node module or webpack alias
body:
Using a **~**Tilde to go directly to a node_module path without having to add aliases to webpack this path doesn't get resolved by VS Code. 

So with a node_module 'bootstrap' installed, we can import bootstrap sass-files using this construction:

``` scss
@import '~bootstrap/scss/bootstrap-grid';
@import '~bootstrap/scss/utilities/sizing';
```
While this is working fine with Webpack and the sass-loader/node_sass, VS Code doesn't recognise this tilde-construction and searches on a follow-link in our `source-folder\bootstrap\` instead of in `node_modules\bootstrap\`

When we use aliases in Javascript we solved his resolve problem by adding aliases to the jsconfig.json. But AFAIK there's not such a config file for Sass in VS Code.
I've been searching everywhere, including settings on sass, but couldn't find anything where we could make VS Code respect the node_modules path (and Webpack aliases) with a tilde~.

So unfortunately we seem to not being able to click to follow link on these sass imports.

**versions**
- VSCode Version: 1.37.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home Updated

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Have a node modulle, like node_modules/bootstrap, installed
2. Import a sassfile from this module, like `@import '~bootstrap/scss/bootstrap-grid';`
3. Ctrl+click on the import line to try to 'Follow Link'
Result: it shows an error-message popup saying 'Unable to open' with the wrong path

**extensions**
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Use icon fonts for product icons
body: ## Summary This is to track updating our icons to use our new icon font (`codicons`) in the workbench. This will allow us to: - Style icons dynamically (themeable) - Allow theme authors to provide color tokens for icons - Unify Octicons + VS Code icons into a single icon library This would allows to do something like below where icons inherit the foreground color of their element: _Notice how the icons in the selected element are different a color than the rest state_ ## Related Issues - Provide library of icons for extension authors #74974 - Twistie/Progress/Octicons/Actions hard to see in light theme when selected #55857 ## Out of scope - Allow extensions to define icon name via contribution points (requires API changes) https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/31466 ## Adoption areas - [ ] Activity Bar - [ ] Sidebar - [x] Explorer - [x] Search - [x] SCM - [ ] Debug - [ ] Extensions - [ ] Outline - [x] Panel - [x] Problems - [x] Output - [x] Debug Console - [x] Terminal - [x] Notifications - [x] Find widget (editor, terminal) - [ ] Editor - [x] Folding - [x] Lighbulb - [ ] IntelliSense - [ ] Breadcrumbs - [ ] Breakpoints - [ ] Diff - [ ] Peek - [ ] Tabs - [ ] Action bar - [x] Settings - [x] Keybindings ## Verify it works in - [x] Monaco standalone editor - [x] Custom views (extensions)

title: Add bidi bracket support

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
As [this](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/65648#issuecomment-520146687) vscode doesn't support bidi brackets. What is that? http://www.unicode.org/notes/tn39/

Sample code: "سشی (شسی)"
Actual:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/833473/62822831-1b5fc980-bb9e-11e9-83e9-7d09c9460970.png)

Expected:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/833473/62822832-23b80480-bb9e-11e9-8a12-65b5d51a996c.png)

LayoutNG which is enabled in Chrome 76 will enable this for text in html, test this `data:text/html;charset=utf8,"%D8%B3%D8%B4%DB%8C (%D8%B4%D8%B3%DB%8C)"` (put it in address bar) when LayoutNG experiment is enabled and disabled in `about:flags` of Chrome (which in Chrome 76 may is default enabled) but I don't think that helps here as AFAIK monaco uses a different and internal bidi code.

title: Multiline select unselects selected selection
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.37.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

Given this code
```
[Transfer] Action 1
[Transfer] Action 2
```

1. Select `[Transfer]` on 1 line using `ctrl+shift+right arr` starting from col 1
2. Use `ctrl+alt+shift+dwn arr` to select `[Transfer]` on the next line
3. The selection of `[Transfer]` is gone and you need to select it again with the cursor now over 2 lines

Serious productivity hinderance...

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Improve search for settings
body:
When searching for settings in the UI settings page, I believe results are sorted alphabetically, which makes users have to scroll down a lot in order to find the most relevant result. For example, if you have the Python extension installed and look for "pylint", you're going to have to scroll down through bandit, flake8, general linting, mypy, pep8, prospector, pydocstyle and pylama configuration options until you reach pylint settings. It's a LOT of scrolling:


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45497113/62794238-68ea1280-ba88-11e9-9d4b-c696b4b9671e.png)

Most of users seem to be configuring their experience through settings.json, but my understanding is that there's no plan to enhance the experience that way. So I believe there really should be an improvement of the UI settings search experience.

title: Preserve search options / Allow default search options to be configured
body:
When I search in VS Code, via for example `ctrl+d`, `ctrl+f`, I get this tiny menu with options like case-sensitive, regex, etc. I'd really like those options to stay the way I like them. But there are to problems with that:

1. **VS Code forgets**  
Not sure if it's after a certain amount of time, app reloads, project switching, or what causes VS Code to forget my choices, but annoyingly often when I press for example `ctrl+d`, the options are back their application defaults: all `off`.

2. **There's no way to configure the default**  
Only search option I find is something called `Smart Case`, which I'm not interested in. I find no way to configure the default search options to be what I want.

Any chance of getting some settings where I can configure my preferred search options in my `settings.json`? And then initiate with those instead of everything `off` as it does now when I start a new search?

If I can configure the defaults I don't mind VS Code forgetting (would actually be preferred). But if that's not a possible, an alternative would be that VS Code just always used my last options, instead of forgetting as it does now. In other words, I'd like one of those solutions, but not both. 😛

---

**VSCode Version:** `1.36.1`
**OS Version:** `Windows_NT x64 10.0.17134`

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Press `ctrl+f`
2. Change the search options
3. ...
4. Repeat 1 and check if they're the same

title: Breakpoint widget should respect editor font size

milestone.title: Backlog

body:

title: Keybindings: provide some guidance on when-clause support

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I find `when` clauses are one of the most powerful features in VSCode keybinding story, but we have only very limited support for understanding it from the product itself. 

We very likely have duplicates already for supporting intellisense etc. for contexts, but at the very minimum can we at least somehow link to https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/getstarted/keybindings#_when-clause-contexts from the keybindings editor? 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/62773448-78765500-baa2-11e9-814c-635a79131580.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/62773459-7dd39f80-baa2-11e9-8ce9-7cfbb16ba9bd.png)

Maybe with some link in the table and maybe with an extra menu item close to the entry for "Change when expression"?

//cc @misolori @alexandrudima

title: compressed autocompletion box
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.37.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home (latest update)

Device: Razer Blade 15 2018 Advanced Model
Nvidia GTX 1070 MaxQ Graphics
15 inch UHD Touch Display

As shown in the screenshot, all autocompletion boxes are compressed, so that they are unusable. Clicking inside such a small box works, but of course, no useful selection can be done.

The issue occures both on UHD and FHD resolution on my device. I tried starting VSCode with the GTX 1070 or the included Intel graphics with no difference.

 ![screenshot](https://i.ibb.co/TMY6jHR/screenshot-error.png)

If I setup a Ubuntu KDE Plasma VBox with enabled hardware support and scale it to FHD or UHD resolution, VSCode works just fine inside.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: New arrow icon cannot be shown completely
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32427260/62756571-d018be80-baaa-11e9-927c-58c4388d2ec7.png)

For this, I zoomed the VS Code with <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>+</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>-</kbd>. In the following 4 situations, the second one and third one's arrow icons are broken. 

### zoom level 1
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32427260/62756644-238b0c80-baab-11e9-8708-7ef72d1c8246.png)

### zoom level 2
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32427260/62756621-1110d300-baab-11e9-82c7-a0216ce7887e.png)

### zoom level 3
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32427260/62756607-05bda780-baab-11e9-84f7-e3acb3f505f3.png)

### zoom level 4
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32427260/62756614-0b1af200-baab-11e9-97fe-5fa475dc961f.png)

The old triangle works fine but now was replaced by an arrow, which is broken in some situations. Hope it can be fixed in later versions.

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.37.0
- OS Version: deepin 15.11

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Upgrade VS Code to 1.37.0 version
2. Found that the arrow icon is broken


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: [themes] Show extension info in Preferences: Color Theme panel

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

In current `Preferences: Color Theme` panel, there is no extension info that lets users know which extension provided the themes. I'd like to purge some unwanted theme extensions, but I don't know which one I should uninstall.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32427260/62754454-73190a80-baa2-11e9-8aba-a03202ccd79a.png)

It will be great if we can add the extension info at the right of theme name :) Something like the below picture.

![ theme_panel](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32427260/62755539-03f1e500-baa7-11e9-919a-fbbcc378c48a.png)


<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

title: Alt to select multiple line cannot keep selection on right clicking

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
When using alt+selection to select arbitrary lines of code. I can't use right click to open context menu for these selection. The selection just suddenly disappeared when right click. Other kind of selection are not

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1042507/62754827-aa37ed80-ba9b-11e9-8281-82e96931ea95.png)

I don't know if it's a bug or intentional but I think it should be allowed. Or it is not possible?
